title: THE WIDOW
author: John Grisham
description: When Simon Latch, a lawyer in rural Virginia, is accused of murder, he goes in search of the real killer.

title: THE SECRET OF SECRETS
author: Dan Brown
description: As he searches for the missing noetic scientist he has been seeing, Robert Langdon discovers something regarding a secret project.

title: MURDER AT HOLLY HOUSE
author: Denzil Meyrick
description: When a dead stranger is found in a Yorkshire chimney around the holidays in 1952, Inspector Frank Grasby gets assigned the case.

title: GONE BEFORE GOODBYE
author: Reese Witherspoon and Harlan Coben
description: When a mysterious man disappears, the former combat surgeon giving him medical assistance goes on the lam.

title: THE PROVING GROUND
author: Michael Connelly
description: The eighth book in the Lincoln Lawyer series. Mickey Haller enlists a journalist to help his lawsuit against an A.I. company.

title: HEART LIFE MUSIC
author: Kenny Chesney with Holly Gleason
description: The country musician recounts events and encounters that shaped his life and career.

title: HOW TO TEST NEGATIVE FOR STUPID
author: John Kennedy
description: The Republican senator from Louisiana shares stories about politics in Washington, D.C., and in his home state.

title: THE LOOK
author: Michelle Obama with Meredith Koop
description: A celebration of the former first lady’s evolution in style, featuring more than 200 photographs.

title: NOBODY'S GIRL
author: Virginia Roberts Giuffre
description: The late activist and advocate for sex-trafficking survivors describes her time with Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell.

title: OUTLIVE
author: Peter Attia with Bill Gifford
description: A look at recent scientific research on aging and longevity.

title: THE PIONEER WOMAN COOKS: THE ESSENTIAL RECIPES
author: Ree Drummond

title: ALWAYS REMEMBER: THE BOY, THE MOLE, THE FOX, THE HORSE AND THE STORM
author: Charlie Mackesy

title: THE BOY, THE MOLE, THE FOX AND THE HORSE
author: Charlie Mackesy

title: WARRIORS: CHANGING SKIES #2: HIDDEN MOON
author: Erin Hunter
description: As the Twolegs set their sights on the Moonpool, the Clans wonder if they will reach StarClan before it’s too late. (Ages 8 to 12)

title: THE COMPLETE COOKBOOK FOR YOUNG CHEFS
author: America's Test Kitchen Kids
description: Over 100 kid-tested recipes from America's Test Kitchen. (Ages 8 and up)

title: THE COURT OF THE DEAD
author: Rick Riordan and Mark Oshiro
description: Nico, Will and Hazel delve into the mysterious disappearances of monsters at Camp Jupiter. (Ages 10 to 14)

title: WONDER
author: R.J. Palacio
description: A boy with a facial deformity starts school. (Ages 8 to 12)

title: THE POISONED KING
author: Katherine Rundell. Illustrated Ashley Mackenzie
description: Christopher and Anya must save the dragons of the Archipelago from a strange new threat. (Ages 10 and up)

title: THE HUMBLE PIE
author: Jory John. Illustrated Pete Oswald
description: Humble Pie likes to keep a low profile but realizes that sometimes you must speak up for yourself. (Ages 4 to 8)

title: HOW TO CATCH A TURKEY
author: Adam Wallace. Illustrated Andy Elkerton
description: Students try to catch a runaway turkey before their Thanksgiving play. (Ages 4 to 8)

title: THE LITTLEST YAK
author: Lu Fraser. Illustrated Kate Hindley
description: A little yak takes on a huge task. (Ages 4 to 8)

title: BLUEY'S NIGHT BEFORE CHRISTMAS
author: Lauren Holowaty. Illustrated Kiara Hankinson, Jemma Bayley and Costa Kassab
description: Bluey's take on "A Visit From St. Nicholas." (Ages 3 to 5)

title: BALLOONS OVER BROADWAY
author: Melissa Sweet
description: The story of Tony Sarg, the man who invented the first helium balloons of the Macy's Thanksgiving Day Parade. (Ages 4 to 7)

title: DIARY OF A WIMPY KID
author: Jeff Kinney. Illustrated Jeff Kinney
description: The travails and challenges of adolescence. (Ages 9 to 12)

title: THE HUNGER GAMES
author: Suzanne Collins
description: In a dystopia, a girl fights for survival on live TV. (Ages 12 and up)

title: HARRY POTTER
author: J.K. Rowling
description: A wizard hones his conjuring skills in the service of fighting evil. (Ages 10 and up)

title: THE INHERITANCE GAMES
author: Jennifer Lynn Barnes
description: Avery Grambs tries to figure out why an inheritance from a stranger was bestowed upon her. (Ages 12 to 18)

title: WE WERE LIARS
author: E. Lockhart
description: The Sinclair family and their summers on a private island. (Ages 12 and up)

title: ETERNAL RUIN
author: Tigest Girma
description: Kidan’s quest for power consumes her as she must face her sister, June, in a looming war. (Ages 14 to 18)

title: FAKE SKATING
author: Lynn Painter
description: After years of separation, the childhood friends Alec and Dani reunite and face their true feelings toward each other. (Ages 14 and up)

title: IF ONLY I HAD TOLD HER
author: Laura Nowlin
description: In this companion to “If He Had Been With Me,” the story of Finn and Autumn is told through three different perspectives. (Ages 14 to 18)

title: THE HOUSE SAPHIR
author: Marissa Meyer
description: Mallory Fontaine, who can see ghosts, is hired by the heir to the Saphir estate to rid the house of spirits. (Ages 14 to 18)

title: STARCHASER
author: R.M. Gray
description: Aster and Will travel to Castle Grim to attempt to break a curse cast upon them by procuring Morana’s blood. (Ages 14 to 18)
